In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Firstly, make sure you have the DataFrames and Dates packages installed. You can add these packages to your environment using the Pkg.add() function in Julia if they are not already present. Here's how you can do it:

```julia
Pkg.add("DataFrames")
Pkg.add("Dates")
```
Now, here is a simple function that adds a new column to the DataFrame with year and month information in "yyyymm" format:

```julia
using Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyyMM")  # Extracting year and month from DateTime and concatenating them together as an integer in yyyymm format
end
```
Here is how you would use the function:

```julia
using DataFrames, RDatasets
df = dataset("datasets", "AirPassengers")  # Load a sample data set
add_yearmonth(df)  # Add new column with year and month from DateTime
```
Please replace `"AirPassengers"` with the actual name of your DataFrame.
